title: How to Wear & Style a Bucket Hat

steps.title: You don’t need bold, eye-catching outfits to pull off a bucket hat.
steps.content: You don’t need bold, eye-catching outfits to pull off a bucket hat. Contrary to popular belief, bold parkas and retro tracksuits aren’t the only ways to swing a bucket hat. Instead, pick out casual streetwear as the base of your outfit, designed in muted colors. [1] X Research source Neutral-toned garments are another great way to build a subtle but stylish outfit with your bucket hat. [2] X Research source Summer knitwear and classic T-shirts are great additions to a streetwear outfit. [3] X Expert Source Rachel Michael Personal Stylist Expert Interview. 30 November 2021. You might finish off a gray suit with a black bucket hat.

steps.title: Match your bucket hat with the rest of your outfit.
steps.content: Match your bucket hat with the rest of your outfit. Pick matching colored garments for your outfit—this might be a jumpsuit, a top and a nice pair of pants, or an oversized jacket. Choose a bucket hat that matches the color scheme in the rest of your outfit—this helps create a cohesive, stylish look. You might wear an oversized, solid-colored jacket and wear a matching bucket hat. You could pair a nice pair of jeans with a matching top and bucket hat.

steps.title: Textures help add an extra dimension to your outfit.
steps.content: Textures help add an extra dimension to your outfit. Pair a fuzzy or textured bucket hat with a textured top or vest. Don’t be afraid to wear multiple textures at once—this makes your outfit really eye-catching and dynamic. [4] X Research source You can also choose a bucket hat that’s a completely different color than the rest of your outfit. Draw the eye upward with a brightly-colored bucket hat, which creates a cool, stylish division throughout your outfit. [5] X Research source For instance, you might wear a fuzzy bucket hat with a knitted vest. You might wear a brightly-colored bucket hat with a different-colored jacket and shorts. If your bucket hat is more understated, try pairing it with a cool graphic tee and sequined pants for an outfit that will really stand out! [6] X Expert Source Rachel Michael Personal Stylist Expert Interview. 30 November 2021.

steps.title: Slip into a button-down top or tee and a nice pair of shorts.
steps.content: Slip into a button-down top or tee and a nice pair of shorts. You can button up your top completely, or leave several buttons undone so your outfit is nice and breezy. Top off your outfit with a solid-colored bucket hat to really pull the ensemble together! [7] X Research source For example, you might pair a neutral-toned button-down with a neutral-toned pair of shorts, along with a bright, solid-colored bucket hat.

steps.title: Bucket hats are a great accessory if you’re trying to stay cool.
steps.content: Bucket hats are a great accessory if you’re trying to stay cool. Pick out a comfortable tank top, along with a nice pair of exercise shorts. As a finishing touch, slip on a bucket hat that matches your outfit’s overall color scheme. [8] X Research source For instance, if you’re wearing a dark, neutral-toned tank top and shorts, you might wear a dark, neutral-toned bucket hat as well. This outfit goes great with tennis shoes and ankle-length socks.

steps.title: Bucket hats are an excellent option for in-between weather.
steps.content: Bucket hats are an excellent option for in-between weather. These hats are appropriate for all types of weather, including those days where it’s too warm for a heavy coat but too cool to go jacket-less. Slip on a long, thigh-length cardigan, leggings or skinny jeans, and a pair of knee-high boots. As a finishing touch, put on a bucket hat before braving the outdoors. [9] X Research source Neutral tones work great for this kind of outfit. To take your ensemble to the next level, match your cardigan and bucket hat.

steps.title: A bucket hat is a stylish twist on a traditional winter hat.
steps.content: A bucket hat is a stylish twist on a traditional winter hat. Bundle up in a sweater, along with a pair of long pants. Layer a thick, warm coat on top, and pick out a bucket hat to complete the outfit. [10] X Research source For instance, you might wear a sweater with long pants, along with a thick jacket on top. You could also wear a bucket hat with jeans, a sweater, and a long overcoat for a stylish, cold-weather look. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Bucket hats are a great choice if you’re looking to dress down.
steps.content: Bucket hats are a great choice if you’re looking to dress down. Pick out a leather jacket and your favorite pair of ripped jeans, along with a comfy top. Add the bucket hat on as a final, stylish touch to your outfit! [12] X Research source You pair some ripped blue jeans with an edgy black jacket, along with a multi-colored top and a solid-colored bucket hat.

steps.title: Pick out a black top, jacket, and pair of jeans for your outfit.
steps.content: Pick out a black top, jacket, and pair of jeans for your outfit. It’s okay if your jacket has different color accents on it—just look for something that’s mostly black. Pair this jacket with a dark top and a pair of black jeans. Add a bucket hat and a pair of comfortable shoes to finish off the look! [13] X Research source For instance, you might pair a black windbreaker with a black shirt, along with a pair of black distressed jeans. You could complete the look with a pair of neutral-toned tennis shoes and a neutral-toned bucket hat.

steps.title: Trace the bucket hat back to its fashionable roots.
steps.content: Trace the bucket hat back to its fashionable roots. Start off your outfit with a 90s-centric top, like a graphic tee or a shirt tied around the waist. Jazz things up with a pair of wide-leg pants, along with a pair of sneakers or platforms. Finish off the look with a bucket hat to create an outfit fresh out of 1995. [14] X Research source Mirror sunglasses and furry sandals are great additions to a 90s-themed outfit. A bodysuit or asymmetrical jean skirt are also great homages to the 90s.
